title: Cannot pass  kwargs to mlflow.keras.log_model method.
body:
We use Horovod to  train Keras model and use Mlflow to register model,

From the  MLflow guide doc:
```
mlflow.keras.log_model(keras_model, artifact_path, conda_env=None, custom_objects=None, keras_module=None, registered_model_name=None, signature: Optional[mlflow.models.signature.ModelSignature] = None, input_example: Optional[Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, numpy.ndarray, dict, list]] = None, await_registration_for=300, **kwargs)

kwargs â€“ kwargs to pass to keras_model.save method.

```
So we passed extra argument _floatx="float32"
```
>>> mlflow.keras.log_model(regmodel, "kwargs-model", None, None, None, "kwargs-model-reg", None, None, 300, _floatx="float32")
```
But encounter
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/root/miniconda2/envs/keras/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/keras.py", line 377, in log_model
    Model.log(
  File "/root/miniconda2/envs/keras/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/model.py", line 182, in log
    flavor.save_model(path=local_path, mlflow_model=mlflow_model, **kwargs)
  File "/root/miniconda2/envs/keras/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/keras.py", line 260, in save_model
    keras_model.save(model_path, **kwargs)
TypeError: save() got an unexpected keyword argument '_floatx'

```
We have not got the cause. Is it a bug?

@harupy @smurching 

Thanks.
